intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The species is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies for eye health and respiratory conditions.
